file_content.text: Good luck on Dromund Kaas.
Welcome back. Congratulations.
The Brentaal Star's waiting. We can't keep them busy forever.
I respectfully suggest you start dealing with our invaders.
Well, tell the captain that I'll be back on the bridge as soon as I've done his errand.
Yes, sir.
Good to have you aboard. I'm Lieutenant Sylas, second-in-command of the Black Talon; we're your ride to Dromund Kaas.
I'm sure the ship will suffice. How long until we reach the planet?
Very good.
Shouldn't be more than a day. The Black Talon makes this run on a regular basis without much trouble. We're primarily a transport.
Hello, Lieutenant.
Indeed. Welcome--it's not a comfortable ship, but as transports go, it does its job.
Is there a reason your captain isn't bothering to greet me?
This is my welcome?
We may only be a transport, but someone needs to stay on the bridge--and the captain prefers to keep to himself.
On our present course, we should arrive at the capital within a day. Won't be any trouble.
I should also add on behalf of everyone--it's an honor to service the Sith and the Korriban Academy. Consider yourself our guest.
Your respect for the Sith is admirable, Lieutenant.
Thank you.
Thank you, my lord. I'm the Empire's loyal servant.
We appreciate your graciousness, Lieutenant.
There's a non-Sith, too.
Yeah, sure.
You should consider yourself fortunate.
You're very lucky.
Understood, my lord.
Are you planning to take me along, too? Or just the honored Sith?
Stop licking the Sith's boots.
You're on the passenger list, aren't you? Coming from Hutta? There's room for everyone.
I won't keep you further. When we arrive in the Dromund system, I'll have you informed.
In the meantime, your droid's in the conference room. We picked it up with the upgrades from Geonosis; when we docked here, it mentioned your names.
In the meantime, your droid's in the conference room. We picked it up with the upgrades from Geonosis; when we docked here, it mentioned your name.
Sorry. I don't know what droid you're talking about.
Droid?
There's some mistake.
Oh? The machine asked for you, so I assumed you were the owner. My mistake.
In any case, it seems someone wants to get in touch. The conference room is down the hall; I'll be on the bridge.
If my droid's waiting, then I should see what it wants.
If you say so....
Feel free to bother the crew if you need anything else. I'll be on the bridge.
And you, soldier--when you're done playing honor guard, get back to your post. This isn't a luxury yacht.
Yes, sir.
All we've been told is that you're some highly placed official involved in some business on Hutta. Anything you care to share?
If you were authorized to know anything, you'd know it.
You're out of line.
I don't appreciate being ignored.
Uh, hello?
Apologies. I understand you have authorization to visit the Mandalorian enclave. I suppose mercenaries have their place.
What?
Of course. Apologies.
Are you going to ask questions or take us to Dromund Kaas?
Enough chatting.
If that's how it is, fine.
If you really want to know, I'm with Imperial Intelligence. I'm here on business.
I'm a spy.
Ah. I... see. In that case, let me know if I can help you in any way. I'd be proud to assist.
I understand you've got authorization to visit the Mandalorian enclave. You must be quite the mercenary.
You could say that. I've got a lead that takes me to Dromund Kaas.
I've got business out there.
Sure am.
Who I am isn't your business.
Not your concern.
Noted. Just don't cause trouble aboard my ship.
Sorry. I don't think I can help you.
This is Lieutenant Sylas. If you can hear this, please return to the bridge--we need you.
Back in one piece, hm? Just barely, though.
Take the prisoner away. Make sure he's locked up somewhere safe.
Warning--my security functions have been disabled. I believe you are in imminent danger.
The machine is right. Sorry, but there's been a change of plans.
What "change of plans," Lieutenant?
Oh?
Bad news.
Let me guess. You're betraying me?
More treason?
That's one way of looking at it.
When our former captain refused to attack the Brentaal Star, he damaged this crew's reputation. Back home, we'll be interrogated--or executed--as deserters.
But if no one learns what really happened, our careers are secure. And if we report that you died in the fighting, I can take credit for this mission's success.
I should've known. This isn't about reputation--it's about ambition.
Treacherous fool.
I suppose credit for single-handedly defeating a Republic warship and finding the general couldn't hurt.
You've acted loyally until now, Lieutenant--I'm sure your superiors will recognize that.
This isn't necessary.
You killed Captain Orzik. I'm not expecting anymore mercy on Dromund Kaas.
You can't win.
You just fought your way through the guts of a Republic warship. I'm guessing you're not in fighting shape anymore.
On my mark, marines--execute our hijackers.
On my mark, marines--execute our hijacker.
My lord--this is Lieutenant Sylas. I have reports that you're on your way back to the shuttle bay.
Sir--this is Lieutenant Sylas. I have reports that you're on your way back to the shuttle bay.
I take it you accomplished what you set out to do. Congratulations--I'll prepare to jump to lightspeed.
Prepare a cell for a prisoner. I'm bringing someone aboard.
I have a captive.
Of course. The protocol droid explained a little about your mission; glad to hear you found the general.
I found what I was looking for. I'll be returning soon.
The job's done.
Noted.
Don't strain yourself sitting in the captain's chair while I'm out fighting.
I'm sure that's hard work.
With due respect, the Brentaal Star isn't sitting idle--we're still being targeted over here.
I'll see you on the bridge. Have a safe flight back.
